timeline.message:
add missing OC attributes

fixes #7705

In the part for `attributes_okapi` I decided to remove the old eclipse configuration
and switch to manual compilation for the attribute_definition.xml analyze tool.

This tool is updated for all OC location and results in more information.

The readme.txt covers the changes.

The attribute_definition.xml was updated from the current okapi version.

In the part `attributes` the icon workflow was refreshed.
This is covert in the readme.txt there.

The shell scripts got some code cleanup.
Only the cache icon overview script changes to present the acode instead of the OCDE code.

The OCDE icons overview file was refreshed and renamed to make clear the OCDE reference.
It got two additional attribute lines.

For the 8 new OC attributes I created the attribute icons based on PD/CC licenced vector images.

add missing OC attributes

fixes #7705

In the part for `attributes_okapi` I decided to remove the old eclipse configuration
and switch to manual compilation for the attribute_definition.xml analyze tool.

This tool is updated for all OC location and results in more information.

The readme.txt covers the changes.

The attribute_definition.xml was updated from the current okapi version.

In the part `attributes` the icon workflow was refreshed.
This is covert in the readme.txt there.

The shell scripts got some code cleanup.
Only the cache icon overview script changes to present the acode instead of the OCDE code.

The OCDE icons overview file was refreshed and renamed to make clear the OCDE reference.
It got two additional attribute lines.

For the 8 new OC attributes I created the attribute icons based on PD/CC licenced vector images.

timeline.author: Lineflyer
timeline.diffHunk:

     <string name="attribute_hqsolutionchecker_no">Geocaching.com solution checker not enabled</string>
+    <string name="attribute_handicaching_yes">Rated on Handicaching.com</string>
+    <string name="attribute_handicaching_no">Not rated on Handicaching.com</string>
+    <string name="attribute_munzee_yes">Contains a Munzee</string>
+    <string name="attribute_munzee_no">Contains no Munzee</string>
+    <string name="attribute_ads_yes">Contains advertising</string>
+    <string name="attribute_ads_no">Contains no advertising</string>
+    <string name="attribute_military_area_yes">Military training area</string>
+    <string name="attribute_military_area_no">No military training area</string>
+    <string name="attribute_video_surveil_yes">Video surveillance</string>
+    <string name="attribute_video_surveil_no">No video surveillance</string>
+    <string name="attribute_trackables_yes">Trackables</string>
+    <string name="attribute_trackables_no">Trackables</string>

timeline.bodyText:
Minimal typo: ACODE

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The third is the ACOCDE, the "opencaching id". This you will get from their attribute-definitions.xml. To prepare this part follow ../attributes_okapi/readme.txt.
          
          
            
            The third is the ACODE, the "opencaching id". This you will get from their attribute-definitions.xml. To prepare this part follow ../attributes_okapi/readme.txt.
timeline.author: rsudev
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -45,8 +45,9 @@ Icons are written to directory ./drawable-mdpi. Copy them to res/drawable-mdpi w
 
 Add a new line or change an existing one.
 Don't mess up the structure of this file. It is used to automatically create missing strings, html-pages and enumerations.
-The first column contains the name of the attribute. In case of gc.com, this also is their internal id and is used for parsing websites in c:geo. So don't change any IDs!
+The first column contains the name of the attribute. In case of geocaching.com, this also is their internal id and is used for parsing websites in c:geo. So don't change any IDs!
 The second is the "groundspeak:attribute id" from a gpx file. You can get them from a cache gpx export.
+The third is the ACOCDE, the "opencaching id". This you will get from their attribute-definitions.xml. To prepare this part follow ../attributes_okapi/readme.txt.
